snippet: The controversy at the University of Missouri highlighted a broader challenge as university presses are finding it difficult to survive amid shrinking campus budgets and a digital publishing landscape.
abstract: University of Missouri administrators complete reversal of their decision to close university's publishing house when they announce that Clair Willcox, longtime editor in chief, will be rehired; controversy highlights broader challenge as university presses are finding it difficult to survive amid shrinking campus budgets and a digital publishing landscape.
lead_paragraph: The controversy at the University of Missouri highlighted a broader challenge as university presses are finding it difficult to survive amid shrinking campus budgets and a digital publishing landscape.

headline.main: Missouri Rewrites Plot, Rehiring Editor in Chief of the University Press
headline.print_headline: Missouri Rewrites Plot, Rehiring Editor in Chief Of the University Press
